newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia Mining still in Bakun project.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia Mining still in Bakun project.

text.p: Malaysia Mining Corp Bhd said on Friday that it has not pulled out of the Bakun hydroelectric dam project.

The company was responding to news reports this week that said it was reconsidering its planned five percent equity stake in Bakun Hydroelectric Corp Bhd, the holding company for the $5.5 billion project.
In a statement to the Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange, the company said, "We wish to confirm that the company has not pulled out of the Bakun project."

News reports in Malaysia this week said the company had balked at paying the 200 million ringgit price for the stake in the dam, which is to be built in the East Malaysian state of Sarawak on Borneo island.

Other shareholders in the project are Ekran Bhd, the dam's main contractor with a 32 percent stake, national electric utility Tenaga Nasional Bhd and the national pension fund with five percent each and various groups in Sarawak which have a 28 percent interest.
Local public investors will be allotted 15 percent and foreign investors the remaining 10 percent.
